lines.line: You too, thanks for freeing me.
It's just a shame the mourners confiscated my equipment.
My distillator. I can't test any plague samples without it.
I must somehow retrieve that distillator if I am to find a cure for this awful affliction.
I was hoping you would say that. Unfortunately they discovered the tunnel and filled it in.
My father's friend Jerico is in communication with West Ardougne.
Hello, I've been expecting you. Elena tells me you need to cross the wall.
My messenger pigeons help me communicate with friends over the wall.
I have arranged for two of them to aid you with a rope ladder.
Omart is waiting for you at the southern end of the wall.
But be careful, if the mourners catch you, the punishment will be severe.
Hello again. Have you spoken to Omart yet?
You'll find him at the southern end of the wall.
The guards are distracted by the birds, you must go now, quickly traveller.
He informed me of your problem traveller. I would be glad to help.
I have a rope ladder and my associate, Kilron, is waiting on the other side.
Unfortunately we can't risk it with the watchtower so close.
I reckon some of Jerico's pigeons might help us out here.
Chuck some bird feed at the tower and then release some pigeons nearby.
I'm sure Jerico can help you out with that if you ask him nicely.
Hello. Have you sorted that distraction yet?
Try using some of Jerico's pigeons. Chuck some bird feed at the tower.
Well done, the guards are having real trouble with those birds.
You must go now traveller, it's your only chance.
I'd recommend you wear a gas mask before entering West Ardougne.
You don't want to risk catching the plague.
Hello traveller. Do you wish to cross the wall?
Welcome to West Ardougne friend. I'm Kilron.
Let me know if you want to go back over the wall.
It's the most north eastern building in the city.
Be careful around there.
Hello traveller. Do you need to go back over?
Okay, just give me the word.
Back away citizen. Only mourners are allowed inside the headquarters.
Back away citizen. Several mourners are ill with food poisoning.
A doctor? I didn't think there were any left around here.
You heard right. Head on in and see what you can do.
Oh dear oh dear. I feel terrible, I think it was the stew.
A doctor? At last! I don't know what I've eaten.
I feel like I'm on death's door.
Yes, I'd figured that out already. What can you give me to help.
What? How will that help? What kind of doctor are you?
You're no doctor!
Pray for me? You're no doctor... You're an imposter!
No, I'm too young to die!
I've never even had a girlfriend.
Wait a minute, where's your equipment?
It's erm... at home.
Sorry, I'd like to be left in peace.
I don't know how much longer I can cope here.
No, strangely enough the people here don't seem to be affected.
It's just the awful living conditions that is making people ill.
Me too, but that doesn't seem to be the case.
Sorry, I'm afraid we're just closing now.
You'll have to come back another time.
Oh, well that's different then.
Must be pretty important for her to send you all this way.
Guidor? This one's on me then, I owe him more than a few favours.
I should warn you though, getting to him might not be easy.
The guards are searching anyone heading to that part of Varrock.
With touch paper as well? You're asking for trouble.
You'd better use my errand boys outside.
Give them a vial each. I must warn you though, they do have a habit of stealing things.
Just make sure you give them something they have no reason to steal.
One's a painter, one's a gambler, and one's a drunk.
Not ideal I know, but if you pay peanuts you'll get monkeys, right?
Now don't stand around here gassing.
This is clearly important to Elena. You'll find Guidor's home.
In the south east corner of Varrock.
Oh hello, do you need more touch paper?
Fair enough, don't forget to talk to my errand boys outside.
Yes please.
Okay, here you go.
Don't forget to talk to my errand boys outside if you need help.
Well that's no good. What if they take my stuff?
Hush - I'm trying to perfect the art of dealing off the bottom of the deck.
Tssch... that chemist asks for a lot for the wages he pays.
Nah... I just use my initiative here and there.
Right. I'll meet you at the Dancing Donkey Inn in south east Varrock.
Look, I've got your vial but I'm not taking two.
I always like to play the percentages.
Leave me alone. I'm trying to find my gambling buddies!
No problem. I've got some money for you actually.
Well, it turns out that potion you gave me, was quite valuable.
I know that I probably shouldn't have sold it.
But some friends and I were having a little wager.
The odds were just too good!
Actually yes... but praise be to Saradoming because I won!
So all's well that ends well right?
Well, there's no pleasing some people. Here's your cut anyway.
Ignorance is bliss I'm afraid. Here's your cut anyway.
No problem.
Next time give me something more valuable.
I couldn't get anything for this on the blackmarket.
Bah! A great artist such as myself should not have to suffer the HUMILIATION.
Of spending time where the likes of you wander everywhere!
Well that's my job yes.
But I don't necessarily define my identity in such black and white terms.
Go on then.
Okay, I'll meet you at the Dancing Donkey in Varrock.
Oh, it's you again. Please don't distract me now.
I'm contemplating the sublime.
Hello again. I hope your journey was as pleasant as mine.
Package? That's a funny way to describe a liquid of such exquisite beauty!
Absolutely. It's just not stored in a vial anymore.
Instead it has been liberated.
It now gleams from the canvas of my latest epic: The Majesty of Varrock!
Well you can't put a price on art.
Okay, here it is.
Thanks, you've been a big help.
Hops don't wanna talk now.
Sounds like pretty thirsty work.
Don't worry, I'm a pretty resourceful fellow you know.
Sure, I'm a regular at the Dancing Donkey Inn as it happens.
I suppose I'd better get going.
Pretty thirst-inducing actually...
Of course I can tell you that I haven't drunk the contents.
But I'd be lying. Sorry about that me old mucker, can I get you a drink?
Oh the gods no! What do you take me for?
Here's your vial anyway.
Oh dear! Oh dear! I don't have time to chat!
Please leave my husband alone. He's very sick.
I don't want anyone bothering him.
Thank you, but I just want him to see a priest.
I'm afraid that Guidor is not long for this world!
So I'm not letting people see him now.
You heartless rogue! What could be more important than Guidor's life?
A life spent well, if not always wisely.
I just hope that Saradomin shows mercy on his soul!
Oh goodness no! But I am!
If only I could get him to see a priest!
A priest! thank goodness! My husband is very ill!
Perhaps you could read him his last rites?
Hello there. I fear Guidor may not be long for this world!
Oh hello, I can't chat now. I have to keep an eye on my husband.
He's very ill!
Now you look like someone who goes to a lot of fancy dress parties.
I'm just saying that perhaps you would like to peruse my selection of garments.
Or, if that doesn't interest you, then maybe you have something else to offer?
I'm always on the look out for interesting or unusual new materials.
Well I do sell them.
I don't hand them out for free though. This is a shop not a charity.
Well I suppose you can have this old one.
It's not in good enough condition to sell.
Please don't disturb me, I've got to keep any eye out for suspicious individuals.
Halt. I need to conduct a search on you.
There have been reports of someone bringing a virus into this area.
You may now pass.
Is my wife asking priests to visit me now?
I'm a man of science for god's sake.
I know she means well but it's only a little cough!
Well it's not killed me yet. So what do you want?
You mean the plague of West Ardougne?
That's the one. I have a sample here from your former student, Elena.
Elena eh?
Right then, sounds like we'd better get to work!
Now I'll be needing some liquid honey, some sulphuric broline.
And then...
Indeed!
Look, I need all three reagents to test the plague sample.
Come back when you've got them.
Oh. You don't have any touch paper.
I won't be able to help after all.
Seems like you don't actually have the plague sample.
It's a long way to come empty handed.
And quite a long way back too.
Now I'll just apply these to the sample and...
I don't get it... the touch paper has remained the same.
Well that's just it, nothing has happened.
I don't know what this sample is.
But it certainly isn't toxic.
This result can only mean one thing... there is no plague.
It seems that someone has been lying about all of it.
The only question is... why?
Oh. Goodbye then.
Well, hello traveller. I still can't understand why they would lie.
It's strange, anyway how are you doing?
I'm hanging in there.
You assume correctly, but where do you get such impertinence.
A hoax? I've never heard such a ridiculous thing...
Ah... I see. Well then you are right about the plague.
But I did it for the good of my people.
When it protects them from a far greater danger.
A fear too big to fathom.
When my father was king, he ruled over a united Ardougne.
But on his deathbed, he could not decide which of his sons.
Should succeed him, so he had the city split into two.
I became king of East Ardougne while my brother, Tyras, ruled over West.
My brother was a good man and was great at many things.
Being a king was not one of them.
Rather than looking after his people, he went on numerous expeditions.
To the lands west of here. On one of these expeditions, he was captured.
By the forces of the Dark Lord.
The Dark Lord agreed to spare his life, but only on one condition.
That he would drink from the Chalice of Eternity.
The chalice corrupted him.
He joined forces with the Dark Lord, the embodiment of pure evil.
And so I erected the wall, not just to protect my people.
But to protect all the people of Gielinor.
Tyras is king of West Ardougne, sealing off the city was the only way.
To stop him and the Dark Lord.
I knew people would never believe the truth.
So I had the plague made up as an excuse for the cordon.
I'm not proud of it, but it was the only way to keep people safe.
While my brother is still at large, I must ask that you keep this secret.
We can't bring the wall down until we know he is no longer a danger.
You're willing to help? Gods be praised!
My brother is currently gathering strength in the lands to the west.
If we are to stop him, we must find a way through the mountains.
There is an underground pass that should lead through.
But it is full of danger.
Return to me when you are ready to face this peril.
Until then, I give you permission to use my training area.
It's located just to the north west of the city.
I'll also let the mourners know that you are a friend to Ardougne.
You will be allowed to pass through the gates whenever you please.
Now, you'd better be off. You have much to prepare for.
Do you need anything else adventurer?
Your enthusiasm is to be commended. Very well.
If you feel you are already prepared then who am I to stop you.
As we've previously discussed, my brother is currently gathering strength.
The only known way into those lands is through the Underground Pass.
Very well. Return to me once you are ready.
And we will discuss our next steps.
And to you adventurer. I assume you're here about King Tyras?
Well, as we've previously discussed, my brother is currently gathering strength.

characters.name: Asyff
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, theatrical and slightly mysterious tone, a whimsical shopkeeper who speaks with flair and enjoys discussing unusual clothing and materials.

characters.name: Chancy
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, quick and opportunistic tone, a compulsive gambler always calculating odds and looking for an angle to exploit.

characters.name: Chemist
characters.description: Older male, British accent, cryptic and matter-of-fact tone, a practical scientist who speaks in riddles and treats chemistry as serious business.

characters.name: Da Vinci
characters.description: Adult male, Italian-influenced British accent, dramatic and pretentious tone, a self-important artist who speaks with theatrical flair and considers himself a creative genius.

characters.name: Elena
characters.description: Young adult female, British accent, intelligent and determined tone, a skilled biochemist who speaks with scientific precision and genuine compassion for plague victims.

characters.name: Guard
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, formal and dutiful tone, a city watchman who takes his patrol responsibilities seriously despite being somewhat unremarkable.

characters.name: Guidor
characters.description: Elderly male, British accent, raspy and weary but intellectually sharp tone, a retired scientist who dismisses superstition and approaches problems with analytical rigor.

characters.name: Hops
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, slurred and jovial tone, a perpetually intoxicated fellow who stumbles through conversations with good-natured befuddlement.

characters.name: Jerico
characters.description: Older male, British accent, warm and enthusiastic tone, a friendly pigeon keeper who speaks with genuine passion about his birds and loyalty to his community.

characters.name: Julie
characters.description: Middle-aged female, British accent, anxious and devoutly religious tone, a worried wife who speaks with urgent concern for her husband's wellbeing and faith in Saradomin.

characters.name: Kilron
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, cautious and secretive tone, a shifty resistance operative who speaks in measured, careful phrases befitting someone working in shadows.

characters.name: King Lathas
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, regal and calculated tone, a manipulative ruler who presents himself as reasonable and concerned for his people while concealing darker intentions.

characters.name: Mourner
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, authoritative yet weary tone, a disciplined plague guard who speaks with clinical detachment while maintaining somber professionalism.

characters.name: Nurse Sarah
characters.description: Adult female, British accent, professional and compassionate tone, a dedicated healthcare worker who speaks with competence and genuine concern despite overwhelming circumstances.

characters.name: Omart
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, nervous and hesitant tone, an anxious resistance helper who speaks in careful, measured phrases with underlying apprehension.
